entries.meaning: (physics, fluid mechanics, electrodynamics) Any of certain measures of the extent to which vortex lines (in fluid flow) or field lines (in a magnetic or electromagnetic field) kink and twist and/or link and coil around one another.
examples: The conjecture made in Tsinober and Levich (1983) was that coherent structures should possess a significant coherent helicity.

entries.meaning: (physics, quantum mechanics) The quantized spin component of a moving particle along the direction of its motion.
examples: To understand this name, note that the helicity is, roughly speaking, the spin in the direction of motion.
